gurmukhi: ਸੁਨੋ ਰਾਜ ਨਾਰੀ || ਕਹਾ ਭੂਲ ਹਮਾਰੀ || ਚਿਤੰ ਚਿੱਤ ਕੀਜੈ || ਪੁਨਰ ਦੇਸ ਦੀਜੈ ||੬੪੧||
transliteration: Souno Raaj Ndaree|| Kahaaaa Bhool Hamdaree|| Chitan Chitt Keejai|| Pounar Dos Deejai||641||
translation: “O queen ! I have not committed a mistake in killing your husband, think rightly in your mind about it and the blame me.641.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲੈ ਮੋਹਿ ਸੀਤਾ || ਚਲੈ ਧਰਮ ਗੀਤਾ || ਪਠਯੋ ਪੳੁਨ ਪੂਤੰ || ਹੁਤੋ ਅੱਗ੍ਰ ਦੂਤੰ ||੬੪੨||
transliteration: Milai Moh(i) Seetaa|| Chalai Dharam Gitaa|| Pathyo Paoun Pootan|| Houto Aggra Dootan||642||
translation: “I should get my Sita back, so that the work of righteousness may move forward;” (saying in this way) Ram sent Hanuman, she son of wind-god, like an envoy (in advance).642.

gurmukhi: ਚਲਯੋ ਧਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਕੈ || ਸੀਅਾ ਸੋਧ ਲੈ ਕੈ || ਹੁਤੀ ਬਾਗ ਮਾਹੀ || ਤਰੇ ਬ੍ਰਿਛ ਛਾਹੀ ||੬੪੩||
transliteration: Chadyo Dhaae Kai Kai|| Siaa Sodh Lai Kai|| Houtibaah Maahee|| Dare Brichh Chhaadee||643||
translation: Searching for Sita, he reached there, where she was sitting in the garden under a tree.643.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਯੋ ਜਾੲਿ ਪਾਯੰ || ਸੁਨੋ ਸੀਅ ਮਾਯੰ || ਰਿਪੰ ਰਾਮ ਮਾਰੇ || ਖਰੇ ਤੋਹਿ ਦੁਅਾਰੇ ||੬੪੪||
transliteration: Daryo Jaae Paayan|| Souno Seea Maayan|| Ripan Raam Mdare|| Kdare Toh(i) Dudare||644||
translation: Hanuman, falling at the feet of Sita, said, “O mother Sita ! Ram has killed the enemy (Ravana) and now he is standing at your door.644.

gurmukhi: ਚਲੋ ਬੇਗ ਸੀਤਾ || ਜਹਾ ਰਾਮ ਜੀਤਾ || ਸਭੈ ਸੱਤ੍ਰ ਮਾਰੇ || ਭੂਅੰ ਭਾਰ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ ||੬੪੫||
transliteration: Chalo Beg Sitaa|| Jahaa Raam Jeetaa|| Sabhai Sattra Mdare|| Bhooan Bhaar Outdare||645||
translation: “O mother Sita ! go to the place of Ram quickly, where he has won and lightened the burden of the earth by killing all the enemie.”645.

gurmukhi: ਚਲੀ ਮੋਦ ਕੈ ਕੈ || ਹਨੂ ਸੰਗ ਲੈ ਕੈ || ਸੀਅਾ ਰਾਮ ਦੇਖੇ || ੳੁਹੀ ਰੂਪ ਲੇਖੇ ||੬੪੬||
transliteration: Chalimod Kai Kai|| Hanoo San Lai Kai|| Seeaa Raam Dekhe|| Uhiroop Lekhe||646||
translation: Being highly pleased Sita accompanied Hanuman, she saw Ram and found Ram retaining his precious beauty.646.

gurmukhi: ਲਗੀ ਅਾਨ ਪਾਯੰ || ਲਖੀ ਰਾਮ ਰਾਯੰ || ਕਹਯੋ ਕੳੁਲ ਨੈਨੀ || ਬਿਧੁੰ ਬਾਕ ਬੈਨੀ ||੬੪੭||
transliteration: Lagiaan Paayan|| Lakhiraam Raayan|| Kahyo Kaul Nainee|| Bidhoung Baak Bainee||647||
translation: Sita fell at the feet of Ram who saw towards her and addressed to that lady of lotus eyes and sweet speech;647.

gurmukhi: ਧਸੋ ਅੱਗ ਮੱਧੰ || ਤਬੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁੱਧੰ || ਲੲੀ ਮਾਨ ਸੀਸੰ || ਰਚਯੋ ਪਾਵਕੀਸੰ ||੬੪੮||
transliteration: Dhaso Agg Maddhan|| Tabai Hoe Suddhan|| Laimaan Seesan|| Rachyo Paavkeesan||648||
translation: “O Sita ! enter the fire, so that you may become pure.” She agreed and prepared a pyre of fire.648.

gurmukhi: ਗੲੀ ਪੈਠ ਅੈਸੇ || ਘਨੰ ਬਿੱਜ ਜੈਸੇ || ਸ੍ਰੁਤੰ ਜੇਮ ਗੀਤਾ || ਮਿਲੀ ਤੇਮ ਸੀਤਾ ||੬੪੯||
transliteration: Gad Paith Aise|| Ghanan Bijj Jaise|| Sroutan Jem Geetaa|| Militem Sitaa||649||
translation: She merged in the fire like the lightning seen in the clouds; she became one with fire like Gita with Shrutis (recorded texts).649.

gurmukhi: ਧਸੀ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਕੈ || ਕਢੀ ਕੁੰਦਨ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਕੈ || ਗਰੈ ਰਾਮ ਲਾੲੀ || ਕਬੰ ਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਗਾੲੀ ||੬੫੦||
transliteration: Dhasijaae Kai Kai|| Kadhidoundan Hvai Kai|| Darai Raam Laaee|| Kaban Krit Haaee||650||
translation: She entered the fire and came out like pure gold; Ram hold her to his bosom and the poets sang in praise about this fact.650.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੋ ਸਾਧ ਮਾਨੀ || ਤਿਹੂ ਲੋਗ ਜਾਨੀ || ਬਜੇ ਜੀਤ ਬਾਜੇ || ਤਬੈ ਰਾਮ ਗਾਜੇ ||੬੫੧||
transliteration: Sabho Saadh Maanee|| Tiboo Log Jaanee|| Bade Jeet Baaje|| Tabai Raam Gadje||651||
translation: All the saints accepted this type of fire-test and the beings of the three worlds accepted this fact; the musical instruments of victory were played and Ram also thundered in great joy.651.

gurmukhi: ਲੲੀ ਜੀਤ ਸੀਤਾ || ਮਹਾਂ ਸੁਭ੍ਰ ਗੀਤਾ || ਸਭੈ ਦੇਵ ਹਰਖੇ || ਨਭੰ ਪੁਹਪ ਬਰਖੇ ||੬੫੨||
transliteration: Laijeet Seetaa|| Mahaan Soubhra Geetaa|| Sabhai Dev Harkhe|| Nabhan Puhap Barkhe||652||
translation: The pure SIta was conquered like a superbly auspicious song; all the gods began to shower flowers from the sky.652.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਰਾਮਵਤਾਰ ਬਭੀਛਨ ਕੋ ਲੰਕਾ ਕੋ ਰਾਜ ਦੀਬੋ ਮਦੋਦਰੀ ਸਮੋਧ ਕੀਬੋ ਸੀਤਾ ਮਿਲਬੋ ਧਯਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤੰ ||੧੮||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Raamavtaar Babheechhan Ko Lankaa Ko Raaj Deeho Madodarisamodh Keeho Seetaa Milbo Dhyaae Samaaptan||18||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled The Bestowal of Kingdom on Vibhishan, Imparting of Contemporaneous Knowledge to Mandodari and the Union with Sita’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
